pageContext.claim: We're growing really rapidly, and the number is now 7.9% unemployment, which normally you wouldn't like, but people were thinking 42%. We've had the biggest four months we've ever had for hiring people.
pageContext.analysis: The U.S. was never facing 42 percent unemployment â€” economists predicted 20 percent unemployment. Oddly, this isn't the first time Trump mentioned a fake 42 percent unemployment while campaigning. In 2016, he regularly claimed the "real" unemployment rate was 42 percent, earning him Four Pinocchios.
